senses.sense_definition: Located inside or further towards the center of something.

examples.text: She opened the <w>inner</w> door to reveal a small, hidden room.
You should clean the <w>inner</w> surface of the glass carefully.
An infection in the <w>inner</w> ear can cause problems with your balance.
The doctor examined the <w>inner</w> lining of the patient's stomach.

senses.sense_definition: Relating to a person's private feelings, mind, or spirit rather than their physical appearance.

examples.text: She practices yoga every morning to help find her <w>inner</w> peace.
It is important to have <w>inner</w> strength when facing difficult challenges.

senses.sense_definition: Located near the center of a city or area, often characterized by high population density.

examples.text: Many young professionals prefer living in the <w>inner</w> city close to work.
The government is investing money to improve schools in the <w>inner</w> suburbs.

senses.sense_definition: Hidden or not immediately obvious; relating to the essential nature or meaning of something.

examples.text: The professor explained the <w>inner</w> meaning of the ancient poem.
We need to understand the <w>inner</w> logic of this complex system.

senses.sense_definition: Belonging to a small, exclusive group of people who have power or influence.

examples.text: Only the president's <w>inner</w> circle knew about the secret plan.
He was finally admitted to the <w>inner</w> council of the organization.

senses.sense_definition: A part that is located inside something.

examples.text: The mechanic had to replace several damaged <w>inners</w> of the engine.
The <w>inner</w> of the tire was punctured by a sharp nail.

senses.sense_definition: The soft part of a duvet or pillow that is placed inside a cover.

examples.text: You should wash the duvet <w>inner</w> at least twice a year.
She bought a warm feather <w>inner</w> for the winter months.

traits.comment: common in UK, Australia, New Zealand

senses.sense_definition: The second circle from the center on a shooting target.

examples.text: His arrow hit the <w>inner</w>, scoring him fewer points than a bullseye.
She aimed for the center but her shot landed in the <w>inner</w>.
